snippet: The disclosures are likely to reverberate through government and financial circles, as austerity-ridden European governments seek to crack down on tax evasion.
abstract: Leak of 2.5 million files detailing offshore bank accounts and shell companies of wealthy individuals and tax-averse companies has torn hole in secrecy surrounding estimated $41 trillion held in offshore havens and rattled nerves among elite; disclosures, obtained by Consortium of Investigative Journalists, are likely to reverberate through government and financial circles, as austerity-ridden European governments seek to crack down on tax evasion.

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Paris, and Chris Cottrell from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The disclosures are likely to reverberate through government and financial circles, as austerity-ridden European governments seek to crack down on tax evasion.

headline.seo: Data Leak Reveals Big Secret Trove of Global Wealth
headline.main: Data Leak Shakes Notion of Secret Offshore Havens and, Possibly, Nerves
